item.title: Writing Haskell with Vim
item.description: Getting started writing any new language is easier with the help of your editor. In the case of linters, they can teach you the language’s idioms and best practices while you write your first lines of code. Here’s how to set up a new project in Haskell and configure vim for Haskell. Basic vim setup for Haskell What you’re going to need: Vim 8 Your .vimrc A vim package manager (here I use vundle) Airline (Vim status bar) ALE (Linting engine) ghcmod-vim (Reveal types inline) Haskell / ghc Stack ghc-mod, hlint, hdevtools, hfmt This tutorial assumes you already have Vim 8 installed.
